intro: Ptelea carolina, commonly known as Carolina wildcherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by oval, woody fruits that split open to release seeds. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, and it is often found in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in woodland areas.
